Package de.rumford.tradingsystem

Class SubSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.rumford.tradingsystem.SubSystem
  • public class SubSystem
extends Object
    The SubSystem is the most parental Structure in this library and contains (directly or indirectly) all other (non-static) classes. It combines rules and base values and is thus the only point to calculate positions and perform backtesting of performance. By containing a DiversificationMultiplier it copes with the diversity between its rules and thus meets volatility target and scale.
    Author:
    Max Rumford

    • Constructor Detail

      • SubSystem

        public SubSystem​(BaseValue baseValue,
                 Rule[] rules,
                 double capital,
                 double baseScale)
        Constructor for the SubSystem class.
        Parameters:
        baseValue - BaseValue The base value to be used for all the given rules' calculations. See validateInput(BaseValue, Rule[], double, double) for limitations.
        rules - Rule[] Array of Rule to be used for forecast calculations in this SubSystem. See validateInput(BaseValue, Rule[], double, double) for limitations.
        capital - double The capital to be managed by this SubSystem. See validateInput(BaseValue, Rule[], double, double) for limitations.
        baseScale - double The base scale for this SubSystem's forecasts. See validateInput(BaseValue, Rule[], double, double) for limitations.

    • Method Detail

      • backtest

        public double backtest​(LocalDateTime startOfTestWindow,
                       LocalDateTime endOfTestWindow)
        Performs a backtest for this SubSystem in the given time period. Utilizes calculatePerformanceValues(BaseValue, LocalDateTime, LocalDateTime, ValueDateTupel[], double, double) for actual performance calculation and returns performance value for the last day.
        Parameters:
        startOfTestWindow - LocalDateTime First time interval of test window.
        endOfTestWindow - LocalDateTime Last time interval of test window.
        Returns:
        double The performance value on the last day of the given test window.
        See Also:
        calculatePerformanceValues(BaseValue, LocalDateTime, LocalDateTime, ValueDateTupel[], double, double)

      • calculatePerformanceValues

        public static ValueDateTupel[] calculatePerformanceValues​(BaseValue baseValue,
                                                          LocalDateTime startOfTestWindow,
                                                          LocalDateTime endOfTestWindow,
                                                          ValueDateTupel[] combinedForecasts,
                                                          double baseScale,
                                                          double capital)
        Calculates the performance values for the given time frame, based on the given baseValue, forecasts, baseScale and capital.
        Parameters:
        baseValue - BaseValue The base value upon which the products' prices are to be based.
        startOfTestWindow - LocalDateTime First time interval for testing.
        endOfTestWindow - LocalDateTime Last time interval for testing.
        combinedForecasts - ValueDateTupel[] Array of ValueDateTupel containing the forecasts for this performance calculation.
        baseScale - double The scale the given forecasts are based upon.
        capital - double The starting capital.
        Returns:
        ValueDateTupel An array of ValueDateTupel containing the value of all held assets + cash for each time interval between the given startOfTestWindow and endOfTestWindow.
